H0.text: who decides where the super bowl is played. The Federal Football Association

H1.text: who decides where the super bowl is played. The United States Sports Commission

H2.text: who decides where the super bowl is played. The Mayor of the Host City

H3.text: who decides where the super bowl is played. the NFL

A4.text: The location of the Super Bowl is chosen at a meeting of all NFL team owners, usually three to five years before the event.

A5.text: The league has made all decisions regarding hosting sites from Super Bowl LVII onward; the league chose a potential venue unilaterally, the chosen team put together a hosting proposal, and the league voted upon it to determine if it is acceptable.
